ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned, well, Hebrew. I really enjoyed the course structure in retrospect, because it was created in a way that we weren't learning confusing systems early on. It was helpful that the classes were small so we can get the help we need individually, because Hebrew can be very hard to pick up without additional help.
Tons and tons of Hebrew, as well as a very surprising amount about Jewish and Israeli music, art, and culture!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Sometimes being a little slower than others to grasp some concepts can be disheartening because others make it seem so easy, but it's not impossible to catch up. A definite strength was the pacing. It is fast, but by the end you will be in awe of how much you know compared to the beginning.

Dina and Adi are both phenomenal teachers, and their passion and the structure they created were the backbone of the class. The asynchronous day was also very helpful for learning (and nice, time-wise). No real weaknesses - Dina has created an amazing introductory language class!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It's one of the harder languages, but if you're interested, go for it! The group of students taking it is fairly small, so when you do find people it's like a cute little community. Hebrew tables are one of the most difficult things to do in my opinion, but if you realize that many are kind of in similar boats about being worried about speaking conversationally, there is no need to worry. Practice makes perfect (please join Hebrew).

Yes, absolutely! The teaching is phenomenal, the vibes are great, and its very, very low workload compared to other L1s (my friends were constantly jealous of the structure of this L1 compared to theirs).
